article.headline: Idaho State 68, Portland State 66
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- David Schroeder scored with 3 seconds left to lead Idaho State to a 68-66 win over Portland State on Saturday. The score was tied with 10 seconds remaining when Portland State's Josh Neeley lost the ball on a drive to the basket. Schroeder picked up the loose ball, dribbled the length of the court and hit a layup. Neeley missed a desperation 3-pointer at the buzzer. Schroeder had a game-high 20 points and Slim Millen and Tim Henry each scored 12 points for the Bengals (8-9, 1-5 Big Sky Conference). Anthony Washington led Portland State (8-10, 1-4) with 15 points and eight rebounds. Jake Schroeder added 13 points for the Vikings, who were held to 30 percent shooting. ^

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
